title: Debugger::exportVar does not check if field has been initialized
body:
This is a (multiple allowed):

* [x] bug
* [ ] enhancement
* [ ] feature-discussion (RFC)

* CakePHP Version: 4.0.6
* Platform and Target: php unit test in php 7.4 

### What you did
- Define a class with an uninitialized, non-nullable typed property:
```
declare(strict_types=1);
public class MyClass {
   private string $myField;
} 
```
- pass a new instance of that class as a parameter to a function that fails
view.php:
```
declare(strict_types=1);

function myFunction(MyClass $param) {
    throw new BadRequestException();
}

myFunction(new MyClass());
```

### What happened

> 2020-04-21 14:55:02 Error: [Error] Typed property MyClass::$myField must not be accessed before initialization in /myProject/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Error/Debugger.php on line 638
> Stack Trace:
> - /myProject/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Error/Debugger.php:638

### What you expected to happen
A nice little stacktrace should be printed
